t: Psalm 31
The Lord a Fortress in Adversity
To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David.
In*pn You, O Lord,*s I put my trust; Let*ld me never be ashamed; Deliver*ld me in Your righteousness.
Bow*ld down Your ear to me, Deliver*ld me speedily; Be*ld my rock of refuge, A*ld fortress of defense to save me.
For*ln You are*i my rock and my fortress; Therefore,*ld for Your name’s sake, Lead*ld me and guide me.
Pull*ld me out of the net which they have secretly laid for me, For*ld You are*i my strength.
Into*ld Your hand I commit my spirit; You*ld have redeemed me, O Lord*s God of truth.
I*ln have hated those who regard useless idols; But*ld I trust in the Lord.*s
I*ld will be glad and rejoice in Your mercy, For*ld You have considered my trouble; You*ld have known my soul in adversities,
And*ld have not shut me up into the hand of the enemy; You*ld have set my feet in a wide place.
Have*ln mercy on me, O Lord,*s for I am in trouble; My*ld eye wastes away with grief, Yes,*ild my soul and my body!
For*ld my life is spent with grief, And*ld my years with sighing; My*ld strength fails because of my iniquity, And*ld my bones waste away.
I*ld am a reproach among all my enemies, But*ld especially among my neighbors, And*ld am*i repulsive to my acquaintances; Those*ld who see me outside flee from me.
I*ld am forgotten like a dead man, out of mind; I*ld am like a broken vessel.
For*ld I hear the slander of many; Fear*ld is*i on every side; While*ld they take counsel together against me, They*ld scheme to take away my life.
But*ln as for me, I trust in You, O Lord;*s I*ld say, “You are*i my God.”
My*ld times are*i in Your hand; Deliver*ld me from the hand of my enemies, And*ld from those who persecute me.
Make*ld Your face shine upon Your servant; Save*ld me for Your mercies’ sake.
Do*ld not let me be ashamed, O Lord,*s for I have called upon You; Let*ld the wicked be ashamed; Let*ld them be silent in the grave.
Let*ld the lying lips be put to silence, Which*ld speak insolent things proudly and contemptuously against the righteous.
Oh,*ln how great is*i Your goodness, Which*ld You have laid up for those who fear You, Which*ild You have prepared for those who trust in You In*ld the presence of the sons of men!
You*ld shall hide them in the secret place of Your presence From*ld the plots of man; You*ld shall keep them secretly in a pavilion From*ld the strife of tongues.
Blessed*ln be*i the Lord,*s For*ld He has shown me His marvelous kindness in a strong city!
For*ld I said in my haste, “I*ld am cut off from before Your eyes”; Nevertheless*ld You heard the voice of my supplications When*ld I cried out to You.
Oh,*ln love the Lord,*s all you His saints! For*ild the Lord*s preserves the faithful, And*ld fully repays the proud person.
Be*ld of good courage, And*ld He shall strengthen your heart, All*ld you who hope in the Lord.*s
